meanings.definition: A courtyard in front of a building.
meanings.sent1: The forecourt of the school was a nice place to play during recess.
meanings.sent2: The forecourt of the church was beautifully landscaped with flowers.
meanings.sent3: The forecourt of the library was so peaceful that it felt like a secret garden.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the forecourt of the house, making it seem even more welcoming.
meanings.sent5: The forecourt of the museum was filled with statues that seemed to come alive in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: An area in front of a gas station where cars can refuel.
meanings.sent1: The forecourt of the gas station was busy with cars coming in to fill up.
meanings.sent2: Drivers lined up at the forecourt to get gas for their vehicles.
meanings.sent3: The forecourt of the gas station was like a pit stop for tired cars needing a boost.
meanings.sent4: The neon lights on the forecourt of the gas station glowed brightly in the night.
meanings.sent5: The smell of gasoline filled the forecourt, reminding him of road trips with his family.
